data.title: Mute and/or volume button for game sounds in while in menu
data.body:
Feature request: a simple mute button or clickable symbol to completely mute the game sounds when in menu's. Menu sounds could / should be unaffected.

Currently I play a lot of RA mod with teamspeak etc. on but it is mildly annoying that I cannot easily mute the game sounds when setting up the game.

Alternatively a slider specifically for the sounds of the rolling demo in the background.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30605469-mute-and-or-volume-button-for-game-sounds-in-while-in-menu?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: [TS] aircraft can't fly into unexplored terrain.
data.body:
1. Make aircraft.
2. Select aircraft.
3. Move cursor into unexplored terrain.

Only unaffected aircraft is the [orca transport](http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Orca_Transport),
Affected aircraft are Orca Fighter • Orca Bomber • Orca Carryall • Banshee • Harpy

![aircraft](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12602985/12867173/4e5985c8-cd32-11e5-9be0-061dba7c46e5.png)

data.title: Remove Map references from MapPreview.
data.body:
Closes #10433.

This removes the ram-hogging Map references from MapPreview.  The trade-off is that it takes (significantly) longer to generate the previews in the map chooser.  A future PR will reduce this delay by introducing a custom map parsing object that only loads the minimum amount of data required to generate a map preview.

This also removes the visible janks when selecting a map with custom rules in the lobby and missions in the mission browser.  It also gets us another step closer to oramod packages.

I have not tested that this actually reduces the memory usage of dedicated servers, but these changes will stand on their own merit even if that does not pan out (which would be very surprising).

data.title: Remove null checks against self
data.body:
Remove checks for self being null in Mobile.cs.

Picked up by a Coverity check which detected that self was dereferenced inside a call to `CanRemoveBlockage` without a null check - but the other code around it has such null checks.

In OpenRA, 'self' should never be null by convention (if it is - a NRE is probably the least of your problems).

data.title: Bug fix #10029 Plane resupply
data.body:
This bug was happening if the next move target was too close to the plane.
The fix is see if the move target is too close, if is, just don't create a Activity to move to this position.

data.title: Ra2 installation instructions for ubuntu
data.body: Can you provide more detailed installations instructions for ra2 on ubuntu?

data.title: Mines will no longer kill players own units.
data.body:
In current bleed, Mines will kill owner units of any kind - regardless of type.
I've added a simple or condition to the trigger that checks if the crushing unit's owner is the same as it's own and returns with no action if this passes.

Otherwise, blow up as normal :)

This can be repeated in current head by simply laying a field of mines in skirmish and making any unit cross them.

data.title: Move CellCorners to MapGrid.
data.body: We no longer need to store this per-map.  Moving it to MapGrid saves a small amount of memory and performance per map.

data.title: Crashing on Windows 10 - error C5145: must write to gl_Position
data.body:
Trying to run OpenRA on my computer it opens I see the wallpaper background of the app and then my computer immediately restarts (as if the power went off). After doing this several times and giving I opened the Windows Troubleshooter and then OpenRA opened had a critical error (yay! now we got a logged error instead of nothing) and here's what it left me with.

I have the latest graphics drivers installed for my card Im using a Geforce 760 GTX and I run Geforce Experiance to keep that all up to date. Any followup questions let me know.

Running OpenRA release 20151224
## From the Exception.log

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: No suitable renderers were found. Check graphics.log for details.
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
## From the Graphics.log

GL Info Log:
## Vertex info

(0) : error C5145: must write to gl_Position

System.InvalidProgramException: Link error in shader program 'rgba'
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Shader..ctor(String name)
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice.CreateShader(String name)
   at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor(GraphicSettings graphicSettings, ServerSettings serverSettings)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
GL Info Log:
## Vertex info

(0) : error C5145: must write to gl_Position

System.InvalidProgramException: Link error in shader program 'rgba'
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Shader..ctor(String name)
   at OpenRA.Platforms.Default.Sdl2GraphicsDevice.CreateShader(String name)
   at OpenRA.Renderer..ctor(GraphicSettings graphicSettings, ServerSettings serverSettings)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)

data.title: Re-read map files on dedicated servers without restarting it
data.body:
I'm getting a few questions regarding the map sync on my servers if they are working or not, because when people join my servers and try to pick a map they've uploaded to resource center for greater than 5 minutes ago, they get "Map not found on server" - Even though it's there.

This seems to be because the maps are only loaded on server start (Same with client).

Is there any chance to put in a looping check of map files after the mod has been loaded? So the servers check the <mod>\maps every X minutes? (At least for dedicated servers, as these are usually unattended)

This way the servers don't need  to be restarted / play a game before they become available.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30515982-re-read-map-files-on-dedicated-servers-without-restarting-it?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Added Factions to Voiced.
data.body: Required for Red Alert 2 which has complicated rules for faction specific voices.

data.title: Load mod yaml via the virtual filesystem.
data.body: This changes our rule/sequence/chrome/etc loaders to use the virtual filesystem code instead of .net filesystem code.  This is the next step towards adding support for oramod packages.

data.title: Fixed aircraft doing an unnecessary wait loop
data.body: The problem that i found was that the airplanes when facing the airport try to move to very close position, making a strange loop. I resolve this by verifying if the position was too close to the airplane, it will ignore.

data.title: SoundLoader changes to allow streaming in the near future
data.body:
This is an intermediate pull request, it's fully functional but not that optimized to avoid too many changes in one pr.

Follow-up PRs will be referenced here, which will add the actual streaming capabilities to `OpenALSoundEngine`, `AudLoader` and `WavLoader`.

`VocLoader` is already fully capable of being streamed.

data.title: Improvements to ClonesProducedUnits trait
data.body:
Two new properties to improve it's versatility.

CloneAmount: Integer
How many units to clone. Basically, if a unit is produced then clone it more than just once. So, if it's 100 then the unit gets cloned 100 times.

SameFacility: Boolean
Whether or not the cloning is restricted to the same structure the Production ability is on. Basically, if a unit is produced from a Barracks and that Barracks has the ClonesProducedUnits trait, it will only clone the unit at this very same Barracks instead of all of the Barracks on the map that would also have the ClonesProducedUnits trait.

EDIT: Here's some more ideas.

For the Clonable trait, have a CloneCount or something. If CloneCount is less than the CloneAmount from a cloning facility, then only the amount stated in CloneCount will be cloned. If it's more, it will not go higher than CloneAmount. With this, you can make "Hero" units completely not clonable.

Also would give more control over the amount of units cloned and devalue making more cloning facilities or even make massing cloning facilities strong with units that can be mass cloned and weak with units that cannot.

Maybe some kind of scaling to cloned units would be interesting, too. So the cloned units could be weaker, or even stronger. I would guess making Clonable able to grant an upgrade to the cloned unit could do this.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/30431725-improvements-to-clonesproducedunits-trait?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
